revised_title: Dispersion of Flexural Waves in Circular Cylindrical Shells: A Comprehensive Study
tldr: This article investigates the dispersion of flexural waves in circular cylindrical shells using exact three-dimensional equations of linear elasticity. The authors construct the dispersion spectra, including imaginary and complex branches, and study the effects of wall thickness and Poisson ratio on cut-off frequencies. The findings provide valuable insights into the modal characteristics and behavior of cylindrical shells, with implications for engineering and technology applications.
